newsitem.title: FRANCE: Sanofi boosted by alliance talk, catch-up.
newsitem.headline: Sanofi boosted by alliance talk, catch-up.

text.p: Shares in French health and beauty products group Sanofi were up 3.92 percent to 557 francs at 1420 GMT on market talk about alliances and a technical catching up, dealers said.

Jean-Francois Dehecq, chairman of the Elf Aquitaine majority controlled company, on Wednesday indicated that the company could seek a number of alliances and mergers, both in Europe and the United States.
Dehecq was speaking to a news conference on Elf's 1996 results, expanding on an earlier statement Elf was willing to see its stake fall below 50 percent if Sanofi found a partner.
On Thursday there was also some renewed talk of a deal between Sanofi and Synthelabo, controlled by l'Oreal.
"There is a lot of alliance talk in the market following the declarations by Dehecq," a dealer said.
A London-based broker added that the Sanofi share had underperformed the market in the past few days following its 1996 results on Tuesday, and was now catching up.
